ns0:StringWithMarkup.ns0:String: LC50 Anas platyrhynchos (Mallard duck, 10 days old) dietary >5620 ppm/8 days
LD50 Anas platyrhynchos (Mallard duck, 19 weeks old) oral >2250 mg/kg
LD50 Colinus virginianus (Bobwhite, 20 weeks old) oral >2250 mg/kg
LC50 Colinus virginianus (Bobwhite, 10 days old) dietary >5620 ppm/8 days
EC50 Daphnia magna (Water flea, <24 hr old; intoxication, immobilization) 0.54 ppm/48 hr (95% confidence limit: 0.3-2.1 ppm); flow-through /97.9% AI formulated product/
LC50 Lepomis macrochirus (Bluegill sunfish, weight 1.0 g) 2.1 ppm/96 hr (95% confidence interval: 1.6-3.1 ppm); flow-through
LC50 Oncorrhynchus mykiss (Rainbow trout, weight 1.2 g) 3 ppm/96 hr (95% confidence limit: 2.2-4.4 ppm); flow-through

LC50 Pimephales promelas (Fathead minnow, 31 days old, weight 0.157 g, length 21.9 mm) 1.50 mg/L/96 hr (95% confidence limit: 1.39-1.62 mg/L); flow-through, 25.1 °C, dissolved oxygen 6.6 mg/L, hardness 48.8 mg/L CaCO3, alkalinity 45.4 mg/L CaCO3, pH 7.67 /95% purity/

EC50 Pimephales promelas (Fathead minnow, 31 days old, weight 0.157 g, length 21.9 mm) 1.50 mg/L/96 hr (95% confidence limit: 1.39-1.62 mg/L); flow-through, 25.1 °C, dissolved oxygen 6.6 mg/L, hardness 48.8 mg/L CaCO3, alkalinity 45.4 mg/L CaCO3, pH 7.67. Affected fish lost schooling behavior and swam near the tank bottom. they were hypoactive and underreactive to external stimuli, were darkly colored, and lost equilibrium prior to death. Measured toxicant concentrations were approximately one-half of nominal concentrations. /95% purity/
EC50 Tetrahymena pyriformis/Freshwater protozoan/ (Growth inhibition) 5.76 mg/L/40 hr; static
